intro: Notospartium carmichaeliae, commonly known as the Carmichael's notospartum, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round, brown fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, red aril. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing near streams or in rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
